Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to create an inventory for an electronics shop It has methods to add, remove, update, restock, list, find cheapest, sort by price, calculate total value & export the inventory It also has helper methods to add, remove, update, restock, find & get the device

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Inventory()
      Constructor for objects of class Inventory, Complexity: O(1)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(java.lang.String category, java.lang.String name, double price, int quantity)
      This method is used to add a device to the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the addHelper method which is O(n) & the find method which is O(n)
      void export()
      This method is used to export the inventory to a file, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories and then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)
      void findCheapest()
      This method is used to find the cheapest device in the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories & then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)
      void list()
      This method is used to list all the devices in the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories & then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)
      void remove​(java.lang.String name)
      This method is used to remove a device from the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the removeHelper method which is O(n) & the find method which is O(n)
      void restock​(java.lang.String name, int quantity, java.lang.String choice)
      This method is used to restock a device, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the restockHelper method which is O(1) & the find method which is O(n)
      void sortByPrice()
      This method is used to sort the devices by price, Complexity: O(n^2) because it iterates all the devices in the inventory which is O(n) & then compares the prices of the devices which is O(n^2)
      double totalValue()
      This method is used to calculate the total value of the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories and then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)
      void update​(java.lang.String name, double price, int quantity, boolean bprice, boolean bquantity)
      This method is used to update the details of a device, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the updateHelper method which is O(1) & the find method which is O(n)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • remove

        public void remove​(java.lang.String name)
        This method is used to remove a device from the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the removeHelper method which is O(n) & the find method which is O(n)
        Parameters:
        name - getting the name for the device to be removed

      • update

        public void update​(java.lang.String name,
                   double price,
                   int quantity,
                   boolean bprice,
                   boolean bquantity)
        This method is used to update the details of a device, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the updateHelper method which is O(1) & the find method which is O(n)
        Parameters:
        name - getting the name of the device to be updated
        price - getting the new price for the device
        quantity - getting the new quantity for the device

      • restock

        public void restock​(java.lang.String name,
                    int quantity,
                    java.lang.String choice)
        This method is used to restock a device, Complexity: O(n) because it calls the restockHelper method which is O(1) & the find method which is O(n)
        Parameters:
        name - getting the name of the device to be restocked
        quantity - getting the quantity to be restocked
        choice - getting the choice of restocking (Add/Remove)

      • list

        public void list()
        This method is used to list all the devices in the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories & then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)

      • findCheapest

        public void findCheapest()
        This method is used to find the cheapest device in the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories & then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)

      • sortByPrice

        public void sortByPrice()
        This method is used to sort the devices by price, Complexity: O(n^2) because it iterates all the devices in the inventory which is O(n) & then compares the prices of the devices which is O(n^2)

      • totalValue

        public double totalValue()
        This method is used to calculate the total value of the inventory, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories and then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)
        Returns:
        the total value of the inventory

      • export

        public void export()
        This method is used to export the inventory to a file, Complexity: O(n) because it iterates through the deviceList which has 5 categories and then through the devices in the category which is O(n), O(5n) = O(n)
